Obviously that’s a goal that I would...

Welcome to the NHL version of "Oprah's Favorite Things" which is just @FlutoShinzawa handing out A+'s like candy to various Bruins for their stupendous start.

urls.title: You get an A+! You get an A+! What other grades would you expect with the Bruins at 19-3-0?
urls.description: 10 A's (four at A+), 12 B's, two C's, and who got the D? Grading each Bruins player after the first 22 games of the 2022-23 season.

data.text:
Perhaps the secret to Kirill Kaprizov’s monthlong success has been that he has been well fed, @RussoHockey writes.

For the past month, the Wild star's parents and girlfriend have been on a temporary visa at his home in Minneapolis.

https://t.co/xIgOmzuGzM https://t.co/tDB8iSd0Jg

urls.title: 'More energy': The secret to Kirill Kaprizov's recent hot streak could be his full stomach
urls.description: “More energy,” Kaprizov joked after his latest three-point performance, which came Thursday in a 5-3 victory over the Edmonton Oilers.

data.text:
The Penguins' power play dismal since late October, @JoshYohe_PGH writes.

But a pregame message on Thursday led to a 4-3 comeback victory that was one of the more satisfying triumphs for Pittsburgh all season.

“There are analytics for everything now."
https://t.co/5TrnMnaWQ0

urls.title: Yohe's 10 observations: Penguins' power-play woes may have been solved by analytics study
urls.description: Coach Mike Sullivan told the Penguins the problem: They weren't consistently blocking goaltenders' sightlines on power plays.

There haven't been many bright spots for the Canucks this season, but Ethan Bear is one of them.

Since arriving in a trade from the Hurricanes, Bear's play has greatly improved a bad Vancouver defense. 

@camcharronyvr explains how: 

https://t.co/DHzQv6rrOb

urls.title: How Ethan Bear's ability to retrieve dump-ins has stabilized the Canucks defence
urls.description: Bear has been a notable bright spot on the Canucks' back end and has provided an element in their own end they were lacking.

data.text:
“Sometimes you just kind of get lucky."

It's a good time to see which Golden Knights the puck is bouncing in for, and which have had no luck at all this season.

@JesseGranger_ dives in on the Vegas players who are candidates to progress or regress.

https://t.co/aFhXM6cW85

urls.title: Which Golden Knights players are due for scoring regression, and which are due for goals?
urls.description: Comparing players shooting percentages this season to their career averages to project the remainder of the season.

data.text:
With an empty net goal on Wednesday, Mitch Marner tied Darryl Sittler and Eddie Olczyk for a Maple Leafs franchise record.

Marner's 18th straight game with a point capped off an  11-1-3 month for Toronto and earned him a top mark from @KPapetti.

https://t.co/qoGt6kICtx

urls.title: Maple Leafs report cards: Mitch Marner ties point-streak record in another win
urls.description: The Leafs didn't play well but earned another victory and got Mitch Marner a late goal.

data.text:
The first edition of @domluszczyszyn's Awards Watch is here, so it's time to take stock of the early contenders.

◻️ Jason Robertson leads the Hart race
◻️ Adam Fox is a Norris favorite
◻️ Matty Beniers remains the Calder front-runner

https://t.co/P21kqqLcs4

urls.title: NHL awards watch: Robertson's Hart Trophy rise, Fox's Norris Trophy form, and more
urls.description: Has Jason Robertson's strong season put him near the top of the Hart Trophy conversation? Plus other awards projections.

data.text:
We're at the quarter mark of the NHL season, and the “it’s early, don’t worry” plea is becoming less and less of a valid reassurance for underperforming clubs.

@harmandayal2's NHL panic meter: https://t.co/wmnbRDAbiN

urls.title: Which NHL contenders outside the playoff bar are in trouble? Who might surge?
urls.description: At the quarter mark of the NHL season, many teams are falling short of expectations. Let's analyze what's gone wrong.

data.text:
Peter Stastny was prolific, but his Hall of Fame legacy is about much more than hockey.

Stastny's defection from Czechoslovakia is relatable to current players — for all the wrong reasons.

"The world has come full circle," @PierreVLeBrun writes:

It's easy to forget that Sean Monahan was among the castaways of a turbulent Flames offseason.

Since the Canadiens trade, Monahan is playing at his full potential again — which is huge given all he's gone through physically.

✍️ @MAGodin and @jkamckenzie
https://t.co/cOxJfxAV9p

urls.title: Sean Monahan returns to Calgary, playing to his old form — 'He's got that jump again'
urls.description: Monahan has provided the Canadiens with everything they could ask for as he returns to the place where it all began.

data.text:
We assumed there was no possible way the month of November could be as cruel to the Senators as it was last year.

Yet again, heading into December, the Senators find themselves deeply submerged in the standings.

@ian_mendes on Ottawa's latest loss.

https://t.co/9G1B0JcyzI

urls.title: Senators end another horrific November with 'sloppy' and 'soft' loss to Rangers
urls.description: Once again, as the calendar flips to December, the Senators find themselves deeply submerged in the standings.

data.text:
No one has the impact that Oilers' Connor McDavid and Leon Draisaitl have on a hockey game.

Their dominance underscored the massive talent gap between the best and the Blackhawks — and why GM Kyle Davidson is doing what he’s doing.

✍️ @MarkLazerus

https://t.co/EQXF85lQ2D https://t.co/ppl4tMTVkG

urls.title: Connor McDavid, Leon Draisaitl a reminder of just what the Blackhawks are(n't) playing for
urls.description: The Oilers' dominant duo was unstoppable for the overmatched Blackhawks and an obvious hint that they need an influx of truly elite talent.

data.text:
Despite again trailing by three goals after two periods, Detroit played the Sabres essentially even by every metric.

The Red Wings showed the effort coach Derek Lalonde was looking for but still came up short.

@m_bultman on their comeback — sort of.
https://t.co/wyDQm0OVcG

urls.title: Why the Red Wings passed Derek Lalonde's test despite comeback falling short
urls.description: The Red Wings showed a lot in coming back from being down three goals in the third period Wednesday, but more big tests await them.

tweets.text:
"Why is everybody so fixated on Lundqvist?"

Of course, there was the player: The generational Rangers goaltender.

Then there was the person.

"This is upsetting because I wanted him to be this prima donna jerk."

@hayyyshayyy on Henrik Lundqvist, No. 50 on The Athletic's #NHL99

Some of the most recent games are emblematic of a wacky NHL season full of lead changes and, of course, goals galore.

"Probably not a lot of fun for the goaltenders. But for the fans, it’s great.”

@PierreVLeBrun on the scoring boom.

urls.description: Increased focus on skills development, a youth takeover and years of systemic rules changes have resulted in a new era in the NHL.
